net.toddm.cache.android

Class DBCacheProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • net.toddm.cache.android.DBCacheProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CacheProvider

    public class DBCacheProvider
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
implements CacheProvider
    An implementation of the CacheProvider interface that is backed by the SQLite database. This caching implementation is thread safe.

    Author:
    Todd S. Murchison

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static DBCacheProvider getInstance(android.content.Context context,
                          java.lang.String namespace,
                          int databaseVersion,
                          int initialLruCap,
                          LoggingProvider loggingProvider)
        Returns an instance of DBCacheProvider for the given namespace. The instance will be created if needed or returned if an instance has previously been created for the given namespace.
        Parameters:
        context - An Android Context for use when interacting with SQLite.
        namespace - The namespace of the cache that is returned.
        databaseVersion - The version of the database (starting at 1). If the database already exists and the version do not match then calls to onUpgrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase, int, int) on SQLiteOpenHelper.onDowngrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase, int, int) will be triggered.
        initialLruCap - The maximum number of entries the cache should contain after a call to trimLru().
        loggingProvider - OPTIONAL If NULL no logging callbacks are made otherwise the provided implementation will get log messages.

        public void onCreate(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)

      • add

        public boolean add(java.lang.String key,
          java.lang.String value,
          long ttl,
          java.lang.String eTag,
          java.net.URI sourceUri)
        Adds an entry to the cache if one with the given key does not already exist. If there is a preexisting entry with the given key then that entry is updated with the given data.

        Specified by:
        add in interface CacheProvider
        Parameters:
        key - The unique key of the cache entry.
        value - The value of the cache entry.
        ttl - The Time To Live (TTL) of the cache entry.
        eTag - An entity tag value for the cache entry.
        sourceUri - A source URI for the cache entry.
        Returns:
        true if the add or update operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • add

        public boolean add(java.lang.String key,
          byte[] value,
          long ttl,
          java.lang.String eTag,
          java.net.URI sourceUri)
        Adds an entry to the cache if one with the given key does not already exist. If there is a preexisting entry with the given key then that entry is updated with the given data.

        Specified by:
        add in interface CacheProvider
        Parameters:
        key - The unique key of the cache entry.
        value - The value of the cache entry.
        ttl - The Time To Live (TTL) of the cache entry.
        eTag - An entity tag value for the cache entry.
        sourceUri - A source URI for the cache entry.
        Returns:
        true if the add or update operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • get

        public CacheEntry get(java.lang.String key,
             boolean allowExpired)
        Returns the CacheEntry with the given key. If no entry is found for the given key then null is returned.

        Specified by:
        get in interface CacheProvider
        Parameters:
        key - The unique key of the cache entry to return.
        allowExpired - If set, this method can return expired cache entries as well.
        Returns:
        The CacheEntry with the given key or null if the key is not found in the cache.

      • getAll

        public java.util.List<CacheEntry> getAll(boolean allowExpired)
        Specified by:
        getAll in interface CacheProvider
        Parameters:
        allowExpired - If set, the list of entries returned will include entries that have expired.
        Returns:
        A list of all cache entries.

      • size

        public int size(boolean allowExpired)
        Returns the size (the total number of current entries) of the cache.
        Specified by:
        size in interface CacheProvider
        Parameters:
        allowExpired - If set, this method will count expired cache entries as well.
        Returns:
        The size (the total number of current entries) of the cache.

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key,
                  boolean allowExpired)
        Returns true if the cache contains an entry for the given key, false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        containsKey in interface CacheProvider
        Parameters:
        key - The unique key of the cache entry to look for.
        allowExpired - If set, this method can return true for expired cache entries.
        Returns:
        true if the cache contains an entry for the given key.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(java.lang.String key)
        Removes the cache entry with the given key, if there is one.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface CacheProvider
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • removeAll

        public boolean removeAll()
        Removes all the entries from the cache, leaving an empty cache.
        Specified by:
        removeAll in interface CacheProvider
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • trimLru

        public boolean trimLru()
        Enforces a Least Recently Used cap on the cache by removing the oldest entries if needed until the LRU cap size is reached.
        Specified by:
        trimLru in interface CacheProvider

      • setLruCap

        public void setLruCap(int maxCacheSize)
        Sets the LRU cap cache size for use when enforcing the LRU cap. Note that it is up to client code to call CacheProvider.trimLru() to enforce this limit.
        Specified by:
        setLruCap in interface CacheProvider
        Parameters:
        maxCacheSize - The maximum number of entries the cache should contain after a call to CacheProvider.trimLru().

      • getLruCap

        public int getLruCap()
        Returns the LRU cap cache size for use when enforcing the LRU cap. Note that it is up to client code to call CacheProvider.trimLru() to enforce this limit.
        Specified by:
        getLruCap in interface CacheProvider
